H0.text: Sediments are what waves deposit to form sandbars and barrier islands.

H1.text: Magma is what waves deposit to form sandbars and barrier islands.

H2.text: Organisms are what waves deposit to form sandbars and barrier islands.

H3.text: Glaciers are what waves deposit to form sandbars and barrier islands.

A4.text: They are typically composed of sand, although they could be of any granular matter that the moving water has access to and is capable of shifting around (for example, soil, silt, gravel, cobble, shingle, or even boulders).

A5.text: The grain size of the material comprising a bar is related to the size of the waves or the strength of the currents moving the material, but the availability of material to be worked by waves and currents is also important.
